Context: The Canadian Learning Bond is a government benefit added to a Registered Education Savings Plan (RESP) for children from low-income families, ranging from $500 to $2,000 per person. Eligibility and application processes vary for applicants and parents/guardians. Applicants aged 18 or older can request the bond if someone else has already set up an RESP for them, while parents/guardians must contact their chosen financial institution to complete the application process. The deposit of the bond into the RESP may take up to two months. No specific program information was provided in the text.
